title: Classic Cricket Legends
description: Step onto the pitch and recall the gentlemen cricketers and thrilling test matches that captivated fans across the globe!

questions.question: Sir Donald Bradman of Australia is considered the greatest batsman in cricket history. What was his remarkable test batting average?
The Ashes, one of cricket's most famous rivalries, is played between England and which other nation?
Which West Indian cricketer was known as the 'Master Blaster' and hit 8,032 test runs during his career?
Sir Garfield Sobers of the West Indies once hit six sixes in a single over. In which year did he accomplish this feat?
The first Cricket World Cup was held in 1975. Which country won the inaugural tournament?
Ian Botham's legendary performance in the 1981 Ashes series, where he turned the series around almost single-handedly, earned the series what nickname?
The 'Bodyline' series of 1932-33, one of the most controversial in cricket history, was played between England and which country?
Which Indian cricketer, known as 'The Little Master,' was one of the greatest batsmen of the 1970s-80s?
A cricket test match is traditionally played over a maximum of how many days?
Which Australian fast bowler, nicknamed 'Thommo,' terrified batsmen with his extreme pace in the 1970s?
The famous cricket ground Lord's, known as 'The Home of Cricket,' is located in which city?
Which Pakistan fast bowler, famous for his devastating reverse swing, took 362 test wickets in the 1970s-80s?
India won the Cricket World Cup for the first time in 1983 under whose captaincy?
In cricket, scoring 100 runs in a single innings is called what?
Which legendary West Indian fast bowling duo terrorized batsmen throughout the 1980s with their fearsome pace?
